newsitem.title: UK: General Accident up on press comment.
newsitem.headline: General Accident up on press comment.

text.p: Shares in General Accident benefited from renewed takeover hopes on Wednesday after the company was highlighted as a favourite bid target by the Daily Telegraph newspaper.

The shares were up 6-1/2p at 748p by 1105 GMT after earlier climbing to 753p. Persistent rumours of a major deal to be done in the financial sector helped the shares climb to a record 774p in December.
"The paper picked out General Accident as the one most likely to be picked out next," said one trader. "That's the reason behind the strength in the share price."
The newspaper said General Accident's life assurance arm gave the company added appeal for those in the industry seeking less exposure to the general insurance market.
The report said that at a price of 741-1/2p the shares stood at a premium of three percent to net asset value, compared with 12 percent for Commercial Union.
